name: places/ChIJhWuCAAL2wokRRN3S217enZA
formattedAddress: 325 E 104th St, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: 325 E 104th St, New York, NY 10029-5501, USA

originalText.text:
When I first arrived in my unit everything was clean. Yes the units are shared ( of course you have your own room, but kitchen & bathrooms are shared with one other family than yourself) but it’s not bad if you have nowhere to go! I’ve been here for three days and haven’t seen any roaches or mice.

I haven’t had any bad vibes from the staff or case workers. There is roaches however they do exterminate.

* it’s been almost 10 months and no help with housing.

originalText.text:
Very rude and unprofessional staff members and case managers they treat you as if you’re not human with any feelings they target you they laugh at your situation they make you feel bad and hopeless about yourself. They talk to you any kind of way. I would never in a million years recommend this place to anyone, if you’re suffering in from depression, or any type of mental illness, suicidal anxiety, or even domestic violence or verbal abuse or anything of  these people will make you feel worse. I’d rather sleep on the streets then to be here everything that looks good isn’t good always keep that in mind this is a crazy day and time that we’re living in sad hopeless I see why so many people are giving up No one cares about the people anymore. Everyone is just in it for the money. No morals or respect. It’s crazy they got money for wars but can’t feed the poor.

1

Answer

originalText.text: Unprofessional in communication practices, also exploits employees and higher-ups try to bamboozle prospective employees in order to meet certain qualifications for grants they receive. This goes against what is supposed to be the mission of WIN.Had an interview here for Volunteer and Events coordinator position as listed in job posting. Management told me in the middle of interview that the person hired would be working in the donation room 80 percent of the time and that the position had little to do with facilitating volunteer and event-related objectives as advertised. also advertised that you must have a BA, which i have. they sought to exploit a qualified young professional woman of color in order to be eligible for grants. never once mentioned pay or work hours because they knew their offer was a joke with corrupt wage labor

originalText.text:
.
This very important NGO is a significant member of the cadre of many types that serve the Homeless and Disenfranchised in the New York City area.
.
If memory serves, WIN provides shelter for some 10,000 individuals, and families with children.
.
Their Programs and Development are clearly doing a fine job assisting their client base.
.
Christine Quinn and her Team of professionals deserve kudos for the challenging work they do each and every day.
.
